data.title: Reflections for Patrolman Charles Wilson Futcher, Sr., Lewes Police Department, Delaware
data.meta_description: Patrolman Charles Futcher succumbed to injuries sustained eight days earlier when he was involved in an automobile accident during a...
data.text:
Reflections for Patrolman Charles Wilson Futcher, Sr.

Thank you for your service. You made the ultimate sacrifice to ensure that those you serve are safe. May you rest in eternal peace.

Sergeant Johnny Sanchez

NYPD

Rest In Peace

Nick mottola

None

On this 81st anniversary of your untimely departure, rest in peace always knowing that your memory, service and sacrifice will never be forgotten by your law enforcement brethren.

Detective Cpl/3 Steven Rizzo

Delaware State Police (Retired)

Patrolman Futcher,

On today, the 80th anniversary of your death I would just like to say thank you for your service and sacrifice for the citizens of Lewes. And to your Family and loved ones, I wish to extend my deepest sympathy.

R.I.P.

USBP

Anonymous

United States Border Patrol

"Blessed are the peacemakers: for they shall be called the children of God."

Matthew 5:9

Marshal Chris Di Gerolamo

Federal Air Marshal Service

Uncle Charlie was my Grandfather's Brother, who I never met but remember my family speaking of him. Dr. Marvel of Lewes De. father was a customer of mine in Newark many years ago and Mr. Marvel senior spoke to me of his friend Charlie who he played cards with when they were both young men in Lewes. My Grandfathers name was Frank Futcher two years older than Charles. May they both Rest in Peace. Hal Godwin

Hal Godwin

GreatNephew

Thank you for your service and for helping to make America a safer place.

Detective Brian Jones

Boulder County Sheriff's Office, CO

To fully appreciate the heroes of the present, we must recognize our heroes of the past. Your heroism and service is honored today, the 74th anniversary year of your death. I am priviliged to be among the first to leave a tribute to you. Your memory lives and you continue to inspire. Thank you for your service. My cherished son Larry Lasater was a fellow police officer who was murdered in the line of duty on April 24, 2005 while serving as a Pittsburg, CA police officer.

Time never diminishes respect. Your memory will always be honored and revered. Rest In Peace.

Phyllis Lasater Loya

mom of fallen Pittsburg (CA) officer Larry Lasater

To fully appreciate the heroes of the present, we must recognize our heroes of the past. Your heroism and service is honored today, the 74th anniversary year of your death. I am priviliged to be among the first to leave a tribute to you. Your memory lives and you continue to inspire. Thank you for your service. My cherished son Larry Lasater was a fellow police officer who was murdered in the line of duty on April 24, 2005 while serving as a Pittsburg, CA police officer.

Time never diminishes respect. Your memory will always be honored and revered. Rest In Peace.

Phyllis Lasater Loya

mom of fallen Pittsburg (CA) officer Larry Lasater

Sir, thank you for your sacrifice, rest in peace always and know that you will never be forgotten.

Detective Steven Rizzo

Delaware State Police

Rest in Peace, Patrolman Futcher. Your sacrifice is not forgotten.

Officer 11169

Patrolman Futcher,

Sir, it has taken over 71 years but you are finally being honored. I would just like to say thank you for your service and sacrifice for the citizens of Lewes.

R.I.P.

USBP

Anonymous

USBP
